titleInfo.title: ‘File 28/62 Complaints about the behaviour of British, American and Indian troops in Bahrain’

physicalDescription.extent: The file’s contents are arranged in approximate chronological order, from the earliest item at the front to the latest at the end. The file notes at the end of the file (f 6) mirror the chronological arrangement.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-6; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file comprises copies of correspondence concerning complaints made by the Adviser to the Government of Bahrain, Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, of the behaviour of British, United States and Indian troops in Bahrain, and in particular reports of their ‘interference’ with women in local villages (f 2). Correspondence from the Political Agent at Bahrain (Cornelius James Pelly) to the Officer Commanding Troops at Bahrain, and the Officer Commanding US Army Transport Troops at Bahrain (f 3, f 4) requests confirmation of whether the villages and gardens of Bahrain are considered out of bounds for troops stationed on the islands, with the former replying that they have been out of bounds for some time (f 5).
